byline.original: By WILLIAM J. BROAD and SCOTT SHANE

snippet: A paper raises the prospect that the expert identified by the F.B.I. as the perpetrator who sent anthrax through the mail had help in obtaining his germ weapons or conceivably was innocent.
lead_paragraph: A paper raises the prospect that the expert identified by the F.B.I. as the perpetrator who sent anthrax through the mail had help in obtaining his germ weapons or conceivably was innocent.

headline.main: Scientists’ Analysis Disputes F.B.I. Closing of Anthrax Case
headline.print_headline: Scientists’ Analysis Disputes F.B.I. Closing of Anthrax Case
headline.seo: Scientists Dispute F.B.I. Closing of Anthrax Case
